author: samwilsn
content: I believe that the "Motivation" section describes the reasoning behind the entire EIP, and the "Rationale" section describes the reasoning behind any choices made inside the EIP itself.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@689161464829050960> is correct.  Motivation is meant to describe why the described thing should be a standard (e.g., what problem does it solve).  Rationale is meant to explain why specific technical decisions were made in the specification.
